title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 16 May 2014 - XWiki
content:

09:30 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <Inge-> tmortagne (or anyone): any closer to having decent Confluence --> xwiki conversion?  
10:21 <tmortagne> Inge-: the new wikistream based confluence paser is working well AFAIK (at leastI did not received any bug report since a while)  
10:21 <Inge-> cool  
10:22 <tmortagne> there is a draft of a tutorial to install and use it on http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/ConfluenceImport  
10:23 <tmortagne> it's basically about installing generic wikistream UI and the confluence parser module  
10:23 <tmortagne> then you put confluence as input and the XWiki instance as output  
10:23 <tmortagne> any report is welcome since there is minor difference between confluence versions  
10:24 <cjd> didn't Clemens put some effort into east confluence import recently?  
10:24 <tmortagne> cjd: yes Clemens did some report and also fixed some bug himself  
10:25 <tmortagne> all he reported has been fixed AFAIK  
10:25 <tmortagne> I got some report from other sources too  
10:25 <tmortagne> the yajug  
10:25 <cjd> ahh ok, I thought it was something new he developed.. anyway I suppose that proves it's being used and working for somebody  
10:34 <Inge-> new job has Confluence.. ;)  
10:47 <spawn57\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <cjd> vmassol: I'm setting up a jira for NODEXWIKIMODEL, what project type should I be using?  
10:52 <vmassol> cjd: it's a lot more complex than this  
10:53 <vmassol> let me document it  
10:53 <cjd> ok then, should I just delete http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/NODEXMODEL and let you do the paperwork?  
11:00 <spawn57\_> hi guys, I'm getting a 50035 error when I try to create a new subwiki : "Wiki <database name> database update failed.  I'm using postgresql, and i'm not sure what to do next.  I believe I gave the use xwiki createdb privileges already  
11:01 <vmassol> cjd: here: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentPractices#HCreatingaJIRAproject  
11:01 <vmassol> let's try this and see if it works :)  
11:02 <cjd> ??  
11:03 <cjd> oh re our previous discussion about svn vs. git, I have noticed that my contributors gravitate toward the svn model  
11:03 <cjd> so I have this huge dir called contrib and most pull reqs go there  
11:03 <vmassol> cjd: I've documented the steps to create a jira project  
11:09 <vmassol> cjd: let me know when you've finished the jira project creation so that I can check if my instructions were good enough :)  
11:12 <cjd> oh I'm basically clicking in random places which have similar words to what you wrote  
11:14 <vmassol> if you don't know what you're doing maybe you shouldn't be doing it… why are you a jira admin in this case? that seems dangerous to me if you're clicking at random...  
11:15 <cjd> ``Make sure that the default assignee is "Unassigned" and that it's not the Project Lead by default'' <-- this is default so it should be good  
11:15 <cjd> err that is to say, you should be able to remove this line  
11:15 <vmassol> I've fixed about 15 projects that were wreong yesterday  
11:15 <vmassol> so don't underestimate people's power to change things ;)  
11:15 <vmassol> when I say 15, I really mean 15  
11:16 <vmassol> possibly 17  
11:16 <vmassol> this was leading to lots of issues that are wrongly assigned to people that are never going to fix them  
11:16 <cjd> yeah, jira is an incredible tool for keeping people employed :D  
11:17 <cjd> ok I think I'm finished  
11:17 <vmassol> not correect :(  
11:17 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/plugins/servlet/project-config/NODEXMODEL/workflows  
11:17 <cjd> can't believe it's not possible to create a single push-button to do all of that  
11:18 <vmassol> check my doc I put a note about that  
11:18 <cjd> right, I'm quite sure I clicked on XWiki Workflow Scheme  
11:18 <vmassol> you could also write a script that will do all that after the project is created  
11:18 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
11:18 <cjd> just did now  
11:18 <vmassol> this is wrong too: http://jira.xwiki.org/plugins/servlet/project-config/NODEXMODEL/fields  
11:19 <vmassol> this too: http://jira.xwiki.org/plugins/servlet/project-config/NODEXMODEL/versions  
11:19 <cjd> oh yeah, if I go into my history and figure out when I pushed out versions, I'll  be busy all day  
11:19 <vmassol> there's no much point in having ajira project  
11:20 <vmassol> if you don't set any version  
11:20 <cjd> well it's a nice place to say when something is broken  
11:20 <cjd> and if I do releases in the future I'll create a version for them  
11:20 <vmassol> at the very least you need to have the version you're going to release next  
11:20 <vmassol> you won't be able to assign if you have no version  
11:20 <vmassol> (assign to a release)  
11:20 <vmassol> nor report properly  
11:21 <vmassol> if I were to create a jira issue today  
11:21 <vmassol> =i wouldn't be abler to do so  
11:21 <cjd> just added 0.6  
11:21 <vmassol> since I woudn't be able to tell against which version to report  
11:21 <cjd> ahh right, I should also put 0.5 since that's what's in the master branch  
11:21 <vmassol> unless you consider there's been no version released  
11:22 <vmassol> in which case it's not bugs but new features ;)  
11:22 <cjd> hmm... trying to think about why none of this was ever necessary w/ github issues  
11:23 <vmassol> it's the same with ggithub  
11:23 <vmassol> exactly the same  
11:23 <cjd> nope  
11:23 <vmassol> and jira is not forcing you to use versions  
11:23 <vmassol> works without  
11:23 <vmassol> it's our best practices  
11:24 <vmassol> if you want to do shitty work you don't need much  
11:24 <cjd> I guess in github people report against versions by using tags  
11:24 <vmassol> or work alone  
11:24 <tmortagne> you can indicate milestones in github too  
11:24 <cjd> I don't work alone :)  
11:24 <cjd> I just second-guess everything  
11:25 <tmortagne> see https://github.com/tcurdt/jdeb/issues/milestones  
11:26 <vmassol> I know how github issues works cjd. I told you have versions too  
11:27 <cjd> my workflow for my project is when something is merged to master, that's effectively a release  
11:28 <vmassol> cjd: if you want to change things, propose them on the list, not just to me, I don't have any power. They need to be discussed/agreed by all committers  
11:28 <cjd> yup  
11:28 <vmassol> what I can just tell you is how things are done so far  
11:28 <cjd> I just want to understand the costs/benefits first  
11:29 <cjd> note that I'm not really complaining as much as I am drilling for unformation  
11:29 <cjd> \*information  
11:29 <cjd> if I see an obvious benefit to a different model, then I will be able to make a coherent proposal  
11:33 <cjd> <musing> jira is lacking proper source integration because I should be able to copy a jira.conf file into my repo and have the jira issue manager created automatically  
11:34 <PappingPeter> has joined #xwiki  
11:34 <PappingPeter> Hi there! Is there a way to access the XWikiRightService in velocity?  
11:34 <PappingPeter> (not the RightsManagerRightsApi)  
11:35 <cjd> vmassol: should be ok now  
11:35 <cjd> PappingPeter: if you have Programming Rights, you can get at the internal APIs, just tread carefully since we reserve the right to change them  
11:35 <PappingPeter> how do i get the internal api?  
11:36 <cjd> PappingPeter: $xcontext.getContext().getWiki() -> http://www.docjar.org/html/api/com/xpn/xwiki/XWiki.java.html  
11:37 <cjd> $xcontext.getContext() -> XWikiContext... with XWiki and XWikiContext classes, you can get at the whole internal API  
11:37 <PappingPeter> thx a lot!  
11:37 <cjd> sure thing  
11:37 <cjd> (You will need Programming Rights for your user in order to do this because you can do horrible things)  
11:38 <PappingPeter> so will I :-D  
12:42 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:52 <PappingPeter> has quit  
12:53 <PappingPeter> has joined #xwiki  
12:53 <PappingPeter> Hi there, does XWiki run on Oracle 12c?  
12:54 <cjd> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationOracle  
12:54 <cjd> there's some information here  
12:55 <cjd> but my personal advice is if it's at all possible, use xwiki/tomcat/mysql because it's what all of XWikiSAS infra runs on so it's the most thoroughly tested.  
12:56 <PappingPeter> thx  
13:30 <PappingPeter> has quit

17:20 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
17:27 <vmassol> mflorea: I'm executing some functional tests and I get this at startup: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/d4ec1935ad1a8d63f6fc/raw/74dd0234f0fb7e7631a4b9a3b33b72b98499714e/gistfile1.txt  
17:27 <vmassol> I don't remember seeing this before  
17:27 <vmassol> (the warnings)  
17:28 <tmortagne> probably cause by the upgrade  
17:28 <tmortagne> caused  
17:28 <tmortagne> sounds like it means our SOLR configuration is a bit deprecated now  
17:29 <mflorea> yes, I'll review the config  
17:31 <mflorea> vmassol: thanks  
18:02 <vmassol> tmortagne: I got the "XWiki is initilization (25%)…" message for the first time :)  
18:02 <vmassol> however it stays at 25% and then it's done  
18:02 <vmassol> is it supposed to be refreshed?  
18:02 <vmassol> (and moving)  
18:02 <vmassol> \*initializing  
18:17 <woshilapin> has quit  
18:20 <cjd> has quit  
18:24 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
18:28 <evalica> has quit  
18:54 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's not a refresh issue  
18:55 <tmortagne> it's just missing steps  
18:55 <tmortagne> currently the last 2 steps are pretty fast so you don't see them  
18:55 <tmortagne> I need to add steps at lower level  
18:56 <vmassol> I see
